title: Pledging value when funds are low
vignette: Someone vows to donate their full core law value but later cannot afford the assessed amount.

options.text: Allow a reduced payment based on means.
They must pay the full amount eventually.

title: Redeeming a pledged house
vignette: A man pledges his house to the central complex treasury then wants to buy it back.

options.text: He may redeem it with an added fifth.
Once pledged, it cannot return to him.

title: Late payment of dedicated value
vignette: Years pass before the donor pays the valuation for a pledged field.

options.text: Payment is accepted whenever it comes.
Delay nullifies the original pledge.

title: Valuation of an elderly person
vignette: A seventy-year-old pledges their value; the core law scale only goes up to sixty years old.

options.text: Use the highest category anyway.
Assess a lower amount given diminished strength.

title: dedicated property used unintentionally
vignette: Sacred tools are accidentally borrowed for mundane work.

options.text: Compensate for misuse with added fifth.
Return them with an apology; no fee.

title: Donating half of one's value
vignette: A person vows to give half their valuation instead of the full amount.

options.text: Half-payment suffices since that was stated.
Once mentioned, the full amount is binding.

title: central complex treasury selling pledged land
vignette: Land dedicated to the central complex is auctioned off to raise funds.

options.text: Allowed if proceeds support sacred service.
Better to keep the land in central complex hands.

title: Valuing children under one month
vignette: Parents pledge the value of an infant less than thirty days old.

options.text: No fixed value; offer a voluntary gift instead.
Assign the lowest valuation category.

title: dedicated animal develops a blemish
vignette: An animal dedicated for the main platform becomes lame before sacrifice.

options.text: Redeem it and offer another.
Offer it anyway despite the blemish.

title: Using pledged items for collateral
vignette: Someone wants to secure a loan using utensils he already dedicated to the central complex.

options.text: Forbidden; they no longer belong to him.
Permitted temporarily if he repays quickly.

title: Partial redemption of fields
vignette: Only a portion of a pledged field is redeemed; the rest remains sacred.

options.text: Allowed by paying for the redeemed section.
All or nothingâ€”redeem the entire field.

title: Valuing an enslaved person
vignette: A slave pledges their own value to the central complex treasury.

options.text: Accept payment according to the core law scale.
Their owner must pay instead.

title: Donating with intent to retract
vignette: A donor pledges property but secretly plans to annul it later.

options.text: The donation stands; intent doesn't void it.
Hidden intent cancels the pledge.

title: central complex treasurer misuses funds
vignette: A treasurer spends sacred money on personal expenses by mistake.

options.text: He must repay with an added fifth.
If accidental, a simple apology suffices.

title: Valuation of women and men equalized
vignette: A proposal arises to set equal values for all genders in pledges.

options.text: Adopt equal valuations for fairness.
Keep the core law's differentiated amounts.
